botanical_details.genus: Symphyotrichum includes around 90 species of annuals, biennials and perennials, mostly spread through the Americas, that were formerly included within the genus Aster. Leaves are simple, lance-shaped and entire, but it is their daisy-like flowerheads that they are grown for; central disc florets are typically yellow, surrounded by strap-shaped ray florets in shades of pink, blue, purple or white

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in fertile, moisture-retentive soil, in full sun if the soil remains moist throughout the growing season, or in partial shade. Add mulch in late autumn. Support may be required - see staking perennials for advice
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by division in spring; divide every three years to maintain vigour
how_to_grow.pruning: Cut back close to the ground in late autumn
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to leaf and bud eelworms, aphids, slugs and snails
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to Fusarium wilt, leaf spot and grey moulds
